p: The main constituents of the needle EO were the sesquiterpene hydrocarbons D-germacrene (18.17%) and caryophyllene (15.42%) and the monoterpene hydrocarbons β-pinene (10.62%) and γ-terpinene (12.96%). The most abundant compound, d-germacrene, has been known to exert cytotoxic activity against cancer cell lines, fungicidal activity, and antibacterial properties against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria [ 16, 17]. In a previous study, the main constituents of the P. eldarica needle EO were determined to be d-germacrene and β-caryophyllene [ 15]. This is consistent with the results of our study.
